name: CreateNewDatastore
description:
Creates a new datastore in Datadog.

Use this tool to create a new datastore within the Datadog platform. It should be called when a new storage resource needs to be initialized or added to the Datadog system.

parameters.name: datastore_description
parameters.description: A human-readable description about the datastore.

value_schema.description: A human-readable description about the datastore.

parameters.name: datastore_display_name
parameters.description: The display name for the new datastore. This should be a human-readable and descriptive name.

value_schema.description: The display name for the new datastore.

parameters.name: organization_access_level
parameters.description: The access level for the datastore within the organization. Options: 'contributor', 'viewer', or 'manager'.

value_schema.description: The organization access level for the datastore. For example, 'contributor'.

parameters.name: primary_key_column_name
parameters.description: The name of the primary key column for this datastore. Must follow PostgreSQL naming conventions and not exceed 63 characters.

value_schema.description:
The name of the primary key column for this datastore. Primary column names:
  - Must abide by both [PostgreSQL naming conventions](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/7.0/syntax525.htm)
  - Cannot exceed 63 characters

parameters.name: primary_key_generation_strategy
parameters.description: Set to `uuid` for automatic primary key generation when new items are added. Default is `none`, requiring manual key assignment.

value_schema.description: Can be set to `uuid` to automatically generate primary keys when new items are added. Default value is `none`, which requires you to supply a primary key for each new item.

parameters.name: datastore_id
parameters.description: Optional ID for the new datastore. If not provided, a default one will be generated automatically.

value_schema.description: Optional ID for the new datastore. If not provided, one will be generated automatically.

parameters.name: datastore_resource_type
parameters.description: Specifies the resource type for the datastore. Valid value is 'datastores'.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: data.attributes.description
parameters.description: A human-readable description about the datastore.

value_schema.description: A human-readable description about the datastore.

parameters.name: data.attributes.name
parameters.description: The display name for the new datastore.

value_schema.description: The display name for the new datastore.

parameters.name: data.attributes.org_access
parameters.description: The organization access level for the datastore. For example, 'contributor'.

value_schema.description: The organization access level for the datastore. For example, 'contributor'.

parameters.name: data.attributes.primary_column_name
parameters.description:
The name of the primary key column for this datastore. Primary column names:
  - Must abide by both [PostgreSQL naming conventions](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/7.0/syntax525.htm)
  - Cannot exceed 63 characters

value_schema.description:
The name of the primary key column for this datastore. Primary column names:
  - Must abide by both [PostgreSQL naming conventions](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/7.0/syntax525.htm)
  - Cannot exceed 63 characters

parameters.name: data.attributes.primary_key_generation_strategy
parameters.description: Can be set to `uuid` to automatically generate primary keys when new items are added. Default value is `none`, which requires you to supply a primary key for each new item.

value_schema.description: Can be set to `uuid` to automatically generate primary keys when new items are added. Default value is `none`, which requires you to supply a primary key for each new item.

parameters.name: data.id
parameters.description: Optional ID for the new datastore. If not provided, one will be generated automatically.

value_schema.description: Optional ID for the new datastore. If not provided, one will be generated automatically.
